data.title: Bring back ahead/behind counts while git syncing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a commit and click on the sync icon in the bottom left
2. Observe how the ahead/behind counts disappear immediately before the operation is done

This change was done in fab6f8871ad234ffe0123265f313458590535119 (@joaomoreno) and it really annoyed me when it was released and still does. It just seems wrong to me and I found it much nicer before. With 1.12.0 the sync icon spins again, but now removing the ahead/behind counts immediately feels weird as the spinning sync operation "works" on pushing/pulling those two things and only when it's done spinning the counts should disappear as well. I hereby vote for reverting that change, especially since now the icon is spinning again. Thanks! :)

data.title: Unable to launch Visual Studio Code
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: Solus 2017.04.18.0
- Nodejs: 7.10.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Build from source, copying the files into /opt/vscode/ via the following (which worked in 1.11.0):

```
    npm install gulp mocha
    ./scripts/npm.sh install --unsafe-perm
    node ./node_modules/gulp/bin/gulp.js vscode-linux-x64
```

2. Run `code-oss`

``` bash
TypeError: Path must be a string. Received undefined
    at assertPath (path.js:7:11)
    at Object.join (path.js:1211:7)
    at EnvironmentService.get (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:13745:59)
    at EnvironmentService.descriptor.(anonymous function) [as nodeCachedDataDir] (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:403:31)
    at createPaths (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:19884:31)
    at /opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:19998:78
    at InstantiationService.invokeFunction (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:12443:34)
    at /opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:19998:41
    at InstantiationService.invokeFunction (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:12443:34)
    at main (/opt/vscode/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:19988:37)
```

data.title: VS Code flickers when running on a high DPI external monitor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0 
- OS Version: OSX Sierra 10.12.4
- Retina MBP, 15-inch, Mid 2015
- Graphics: AMD Radeon R9 M370X 2048 MB Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  VS Code maximized (not full screen)
2.  Click in Javascript or HTML file

Extensions installed:
- dzannotti.vscode-babel-coloring
- waderyan.babelrc
- ceps.theme-darcula
- gerane.theme-dark-dracula
- HvyIndustries.crane
- donjayamanne.python 

Etc:
- Occurs when all plugins are disabled
- Does not occur when window is not in focus
- Problem did not occur until most recent VS Code update.
- Occurs on external 4k display at 3360x1890 but not on built-in MBP display at 1920x1200

Happy to provide more info if needed. Thanks so much for all of your great work, I love VS Code!

![html_flicker](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4174039/25726379/71b2ba50-30e9-11e7-92cb-62e098a7e629.gif)
![file_tree_flicker](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4174039/25726380/71bead2e-30e9-11e7-915b-082d36de1ce9.gif)

data.title: release notes are NOT searchable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12


- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open release notes
2. search for string (Cmd-F) such as  work.
3. Scream

The release notes seem to be some of bizarre presentation format, which I am sure is obvious to VS Code developer/documenter, but while it is presented in a document window, it's a truly royal pain to navigate as document.  The particular of this bug is that's not searchable, but more generally, THINGS IN DOCUMENT WINDOWS SHOULD ACT LIKE DOCUMENTS. 

If the document is REALLY a web page, OPEN A WEB BROWSER (https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_12) for the user so they have an suitable experience (which btw, supports searching).  At minimum, the top of the document should state:
* it's not normal document (state what it **is**)
* Include a link to the web version of the document

data.title: Close (Working Tree) tab when discarding changes in Source Control panel
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0 (1.12.0)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Source Control Panel
2. Select file with changes from uncommitted changes list (opens file)
3. Discard changes to currently open file

Would be nice if the `openFile.js (Working Tree)` tab auto-closed or switched to the original file version since people will frequently review the contents of a file before discarding all their changes to it.

data.title: Improved search in "Go to file" panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Would love to see a more accurate search for what I'm actually searching for. For example when I'm searching for "archive" and I'am in mid sentence i get these results:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8997319/25721150/bc83aa46-310f-11e7-9edf-6ce228bd7ec4.png)

I think, at least for me that the index.js inside the archive folder file is much more relevant than the .babelrc and yarn.lock. Sublime on the other hand does exactly what I want. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8997319/25721267/16265666-3110-11e7-8bda-1f630b3f81f6.png)

This change would make the workflow with VS Code even better than it already is

data.title: Slow performance resizing the panel when editors are showing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.4
- Resolution: 2560x1440 @ 60Hz . with the editor at full screen size.  When resized to ~half of the screen, the UI issue below does not occur.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open vsc with opened editors
2.  Open integrated terminal
3.  Resize integrated terminal and experience the unresponsive UI refresh.
4.  Open a few files
5.  Enable split editor and resize the different columns to experience the unresponsive UI refresh.

data.title: Cannot download extensions / proxy settings
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: x86_64 GNU/Linux (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS)

Hi, I'm afraid that other people have asked this, but I didn't find any solution yet. I am behind a proxy and I cannot download extensions. On the console windows ( 'Help -> Toggle Developer Tools) I can see the following message: 

extensionquery (failed) err::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED

And regarding the proxy settings I have the environment set correctly:

ftp_proxy=ftp://user:pass@proxyserver:8080/
http_proxy=http://user:pass@proxyserver:8080/
https_proxy=https://user:pass@proxyserver:8080/
socks_proxy=socks://user:pass@proxyserver:8080/

I tried programming the proxy settings in preferences but it doesn't help:

{
    "window.zoomLevel": -1,
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false,
    "http.proxy": "http://user:pass@proxyserver:8080"
}

I have checked also with the last version of code-insiders but I haven't succeeded. 

Could anyone help me? Thank you in advance..

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install visual code 
2. Program proxy preferences
3. try to download/find extensions

data.title: Improve native tabs (Sierra) functionality
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable window.nativeTabs in settings
2. Click on View -> Show Tab Bar
3. Try to open a new tab now - there is no File -> New Tab, pressing cmd+shift+t or cmd+t doesn't open a tab either, double clicking the tab also doesn't do anything.

The only way to use the new native tab on macOS is to open a new vscode window then drag one tab into another window.

data.title: v1.12.0 update errors on c# Targets: Error processing 'configurationDone' request. Unknown Error: 0x89720010
data.body:

   - 72672be0b7d3eef0784077b880615f91b7ec85aa
   - 2017-05-04T16:07:40.729Z
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.6)

With today's release of VS Code 1.12.0, debugging my ASP.NET Core now gives error: 

> Error processing 'configurationDone' request. Unknown Error: 0x89720010

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1213591/25719353/c27ed452-30ce-11e7-8e09-3002a6335b37.png)

No issues up until this update.


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update to VS Code 1.12.0

2. Debug application by pressing green arrow.

This occurs with every ASP.NET Core web application or DotNet Core command line application I've created (all of which previously debugged without issue).

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Steps to Reproduce:

---

Language = CZ/SK

Dobr de, ke psem kd jQuery do HTML sboru, IntelliSense automaticky dopluje "asti" kdu, ale v prpade e jQuery kd pem do externho sboru, tak to nefunguje, a musm psa cel kd rune (IntelliSense nedopluje kd).

data.title: Open Editors section breaks slow double-clicking a file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If you click an unopened file, its name is added to the Open Editors section. This moves the file tree below down by one row.

If you are slightly slow to make the second click in a double-click mouse input, the clicked file will be added to the Open Editors section, the file tree will move down by one row, and your second click will land on the file tree item above what you meant to click on, which just displays that item instead.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.4 (16E195)
